title: C++ Basics Quiz
description: Introductory questions about C++ syntax, input/output, and fundamental concepts.

quiz.question: The __________ is(are) used to display information on the computer's screen.
Which of the following must be included in any program that uses the cout object?
In a cout statement, which of the following will advance the output position to the beginning of the next line?

options: Roses are red and violets/nare blue
Roses are red and violets/n are blue

quiz.question:
Assuming that a program has the following string object definition, which statement correctly assigns the string literal 'Jane' to the string object?
string name;
In memory, C++ automatically places a(n) __________ at the end of string literals which __________.
options: semicolon, indicates the end of the statement
null terminator, marks the end of the string
bracket, marks the end of the string

quiz.question: The data type of a variable whose value can be either true or false is

What data type does the compiler determine for the variable cost in the following statement?
auto cost = 14.95;
The __________ causes a program to wait until information is typed at the keyboard and the [Enter] key is pressed.
The __________ operator always follows the cin object, and the __________ operator follows the cout object.
Which of the following must be included in any program that uses the cin object?
Which of the following will allow the user to input the values 15 and 20 and have them stored in variables named base and height, respectively?
This manipulator is used to establish a field width for the value that follows it:
You can control the number of significant digits in your output with the __________ manipulator.
Which of the following functions tells the cin object to skip one or more characters in the keyboard buffer?
__________ reads a line of input, including leading and embedded spaces, and stores it in a string object.
Which of the following statements will read an entire line of input into the string object, address?

options: You need to study harder next time.
You failed the test.\nYou need to study harder next time.
You passed the test.\nYou need to study harder next time.

quiz.question: These types of arguments are passed to parameters automatically if no argument is provided in the function call.
When used as parameters, these types of variables allow a function to access the parameter's original argument:
The __________ is automatically appended to a character array when it is initialized with a string constant.
An array of string objects that will hold five names would be declared with which of the following statements?

In the following statement, what does int mean?
int *ptr = nullptr;
options: The variable named *ptr will store an integer value.
The variable named *ptr will store an asterisk and an integer value
ptr is a pointer variable and will store the address of an integer variable.
The variable named *ptr will store the value in nullptr.

quiz.question: Which of the following statements deletes memory that has been dynamically allocated for an array?

The following statement __________
int *ptr = new int;
options: assigns an integer less than 32767 to the variable ptr
assigns an address to the variable ptr
creates a new pointer named int

quiz.question: Which of the following defines a unique_ptr named uniq that points to a dynamically allocated int?
